page.title: 05Buildings
page.content: The village of Cranfield has seen much infilling and extension away from the main village core due to the presence of the Institute of Technology and pressure from commuters.The development along the road to Broad Green and East End was inter-war ribbon development with areas of housing "infilled" (such as Partridge Piece) up to the present day.Shops and services were provided with these developments resulting in a straggling urban form away from the original village centre. Bourne End retains its own character as a community of mainly pastoral farms.A Mission Room built here in 1871 may have served as the infant school for Bourne End for a short time late in the century.Upper Shelton has expanded laterally along the Wootton road and southwards.
